alert.note: Alert for Grayson; Smyth; Wythe (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 15 at 4:09PM EDT until July 15 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Western Grayson County in southwestern Virginia... Southeastern Smyth County in southwestern Virginia... Southwestern Wythe County in southwestern Virginia... * Until 1015 PM EDT Saturday. * At 409 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 3 inches in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Sugar Grove... Mount Rogers National Recreation Area... Mouth Of Wilson... Whitetop... Troutdale... Rugby... Volney... This includes the following streams and drainages... Bear Branch, East Dry Run Fork, Bridle Creek, Dry Run, Deans Branch, Comers Rock Branch, Comers Creek, Big Horse Creek, Blue Spring Creek, Cripple Creek, Dry Creek, Fox Creek, Middle Fox Creek, Dickey Creek, and feeder creeks into the South Fork of the Holston River. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
